info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 23 at 9:44PM EDT until March 25 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Transylvania County in Western North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 1245 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 941 PM EDT, Lingering excessive runoff will continue to occur through the latter half of the evening throughout several tributaries of the French Broad River, especially Davidson and Little Rivers. Also flooding will expand in coverage along the French Broad River Valley proper from just downstream of Rosman to Blantyre. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Brevard, Rosman, Looking Glass, Dupont State Forest, Connestee, Penrose, and Cedar Mountain. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
